messages.text:
Anati, you were right.
You are right.
I shouldn't have to stockpile water containers in my yard.
I shouldn't have to tremble when my daughter returns through Arab-populated areas, or wonder if my son isn't in a bunker because they abandon him and nobody cares.
I shouldn't have to sleep in an empty bed while my wife and kids are crammed in the safe room.
My son shouldn't have to get anxiety attacks, or nightmares because of sirens.
I shouldn't have to install bolts on the safe room to prevent the slaughter of my children by commando fighters from Gaza.
And a motorcycle in the street shouldn't trigger my flight or fight response.
We're just peace-loving people, and we don't deserve trauma like this.
I agree to go back to Irvine. As crazy as it sounds, because until a month ago I was really doing well here.
But everyone was right, all the tech workers who left, it's no longer good here. Everything is rotten. Everything.
Let's start over in California.
There the kids and we can heal from the traumas.
Let's start planning.
